column4: Can someone tell me the name of the (Windows) tool which puts an iso onto a thumbdrive and makes it bootable?
Unetbootin is the most popular one.
thanks thats exactly what i was thinking of
Try gnome-desktop?
gnome-desktop and probably gnome-session. Maybe gnome-base, I don't remember.
i go with ... GDM, gnome-session, thunderbird, open-office.org-writer, firefox-3.0, network-manager, wireless-tools AND ALL THEIR DEPS now, do you think this will yield a working desktop?
Why shouldn't it?
The link will explain.
Are you running notification-daemon or notify-osd?
The pretty black popups are created by notify-osd, install that.
neither nor.
worked fine, thanks
It might write to /dev/tty instead of stdout.
What terminal are you using? gnome-terminal, xterm, Linux console, PuTTY?
And doesn't it have scrollbars?
yep, there it is
What do you mean by "ROOT"? The superuser account?
audacity?
If you want something really simple, use good old text-based login.
See also: "useless use of 'cat' award"
i know :>
